TypeSignature.Value: public class URLClassLoader : Java.Security.SecureClassLoader, IDisposable, Java.IO.ICloseable
.class public auto ansi beforefieldinit URLClassLoader extends Java.Security.SecureClassLoader implements class Android.Runtime.IJavaObject, class Java.IO.ICloseable, class System.IDisposable

Docs.summary: This class loader is responsible for loading classes and resources from a list of URLs which can refer to either directories or JAR files.

remarks.para: This class loader is responsible for loading classes and resources from a list of URLs which can refer to either directories or JAR files. Classes loaded by this URLClassLoader are granted permission to access the URLs contained in the URL search list.

MemberSignature.Value: public URLClassLoader (Java.Net.URL[] urls);
.method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class Java.Net.URL[] urls) cil managed

remarks.para: Constructs a new URLClassLoader instance. The newly created instance will have the system ClassLoader as its parent. URLs that end with "/" are assumed to be directories, otherwise they are assumed to be JAR files.

MemberSignature.Value: public URLClassLoader (Java.Net.URL[] urls, Java.Lang.ClassLoader parent);
.method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class Java.Net.URL[] urls, class Java.Lang.ClassLoader parent) cil managed

remarks.para: Constructs a new URLClassLoader instance. The newly created instance will have the system ClassLoader as its parent. URLs that end with "/" are assumed to be directories, otherwise they are assumed to be JAR files.

remarks.para: Constructs a new URLClassLoader instance. The newly created instance will have the specified ClassLoader as its parent and use the specified factory to create stream handlers. URLs that end with "/" are assumed to be directories, otherwise they are assumed to be JAR files.

MemberSignature.Value: protected override Type ThresholdType { get; }
.property instance class System.Type ThresholdType

Docs.summary: This API supports the Mono for Android infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
Docs.value: A which provides the declaring type.

remarks.para: This property is used to control virtual vs. non virtual method dispatch against the underlying JNI object. When this property is equal to the declaring type, then virtual method invocation against the JNI object is performed; otherwise, we assume that the method was overridden by a derived type, and perform non-virtual methdo invocation.
